ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: The degree of interest and concern shown for me and my child by the professional(s) administering the treatment has been
Notes: 1=Poor; 2=Fair; 3= slightly below average; 4=Average; 5= Slightly above average; 6=high; 7=Superior

ElementDescription: The skill level of professional(s) administrating the treatment has been
Notes: 1=Poor; 2=Fair; 3= slightly below average; 4=Average; 5= Slightly above average; 6=high; 7=Superior

ElementDescription: The demands placed upon me and my family by the assessment and testing components (e.g., completing forms, questionnaires, interviews) of the study were
Notes: 1=Very unacceptable; 2=Unacceptable; 3= Slightly unacceptable; 4=Neutral; 5= Slightly acceptable; 6=Acceptable; 7=Very acceptable

ElementDescription: Disregarding the assessment and testing components of the study, the demands placed upon me and my family by the treatment we received were
Notes: 1=Very unacceptable; 2=Unacceptable; 3= Slightly unacceptable; 4=Neutral; 5= Slightly acceptable; 6=Acceptable; 7=Very acceptable

ElementDescription: The length of duration of the treatment program that I/my child received was
Notes: 1=Much too short; 2=Too short; 3= slightly too short; 4=Appropriate; 5= Slightly too long; 6=too long; 7=Much too long

ElementDescription: Would you recommend the treatment(s) that you received to a friend or relative who had a child with an anxiety disorder
Notes: 1=I would strongly not recommend; 2=I would not recommend; 3= I might not recommend; 4=Neutral; 5= I might recommend; 6=I would recommend; 7=I would strongly recommend

ElementDescription: Overall, my level of satisfaction with quality of the treatment services that I have received is
Notes: 1=Very dissatisfied; 2=Dissatisfied; 3= Slightly dissatisfied; 4=Neutral; 5= Slightly satisfied; 6=Satisfied; 7=Very satisfied

ElementDescription: The major problems that originally prompted me to begin treatment for my child are at this point
Notes: 1=Much worse; 2=Worse; 3= slightly worse; 4=Unchanged; 5= Slightly improved; 6=Improved; 7=Much improved

ElementDescription: My feelings at this point about my childs progress are that I am
Notes: 1=Very dissatisfied; 2=Dissatisfied; 3= Slightly dissatisfied; 4=Neutral; 5= Slightly satisfied; 6=Satisfied; 7=Very satisfied

ElementDescription: Prior to beginning treatment, my outlook for my childs future was
Notes: 1=Very pessimistic; 2=Pessimistic; 3= slightly pessimistic; 4=Neutral; 5= Slightly optimistic; 6=Optimistic; 7=Very optimistic

ElementDescription: At this point in time, my outlook for my childs future is
Notes: 1=Poor; 2=Fair; 3= slightly below average; 4=Average; 5= Slightly above average; 6=high; 7=Superior

ElementDescription: The thing that I liked most about the treatment I received was
The thing that I liked least about the treatment I received was
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Days since baseline
Assessment Point
Notes: D=MTA baseline assessment; 14=MTA 14 month assessment; E=MTA early termination assessment; B = MTA Pre-Baseline Screening Assessment (579/579); 09 = MTA 9 Month Assessment (530/530); 24=MTA 24 month assessment; LB=LNCG baseline assessment; 36=MTA and LNCG 3 year assessment; 72=MTA and LNCG 6 year assessment; 96=MTA and LNCG 8 year assessment; 03 = MTA 3 Month Assessment (438/687);120=MTA and LNCG 10 year assessment; 7= 7th Grade Assessment (221/276); 144 = MTA & LNCG 12 Month Assessment (578/578); 168 = MTA & LNCG 14 Month Assessment (585/585); 192 = MTA & LNCG 16 Month Assessment (505/505); C = MTA Pre-Baseline Screening Assessment (78/78)

ElementDescription: Active status
Notes: 0=Inactive-Data collected after the 14 month treatment phase/after early termination from treatment phase/prior to treatment phase; 1=Active-Data collected during the 14 month treatment phase while subject received originally assigned treatment regardless of degree of compliance; 2=Active-This is the last active assessment for subjects who were about to violate treatment arm by receiving alternate treatment; 3=Active-This is the last active assessment for subjects who were about to leave the study by moving away;4=Yes, Active; 5=No, Not Active

ElementDescription: Site
Notes: Study Site

ElementDescription: Subject type
Notes: 1=MTA randomized trial subject; 2=Local normative comparison group (LNCG) subject

ElementDescription: Consumer satisfaction total mean score
Consumer satisfaction total total score
How dissatisfied or satisfied were you with the overall health care available to you during the past 6 months?
Notes: 1 = very dissatisfied; 2 = dissatisfied; 3 = neither satisfied nor dissatisfied; 4 = satisfied; 5 = very satisfied

ElementDescription: How dissatisfied or satisfied were you with the health care available to you for personal or emotional problems in the past 6 months?
Notes: 1 = very dissatisfied; 2 = dissatisfied; 3 = neither satisfied nor dissatisfied; 4 = satisfied; 5 = very satisfied

ElementDescription: Clinic ID
Intervention Status
Notes: 1=ITV, intervention; 0=TAU, treatment as usual

ElementDescription: Visit name
Study; The code for each individual study
Form used/assessment name
What part of the program was most helpful to you?
What part of the program was least helpful to you?
How could the program have been improved to help you more?
My child's problems that have been treated at the clinic are at this point
Notes: 1= considerably worse; 2= worse; 3= slightly worse; 4= the same; 5= slightly improved; 6= improved; 7= greatly improved

ElementDescription: My child's problems that have not been treated at the clinic are
Notes: 1= considerably worse; 2= worse; 3= slightly worse; 4= the same; 5= slightly improved; 6= improved; 7= greatly improved

ElementDescription: To what degree has the treatment program helped with other general or personal or family problems not directly related to your child?
Notes: 1= hindered much more than helped; 2= hindered; 3= hindered slightly; 4= neither helped nor hindered; 5= helped slightly; 6= helped; 7= helped very much

ElementDescription: At this point, my expectation for a satisfactory outcome of the treatment is
Notes: 1= very pessimistic; 2= pessimistic; 3= slightly pessimistic; 4= neutral; 5= slightly optimistic; 6= optimistic; 7= very optimistic

ElementDescription: I feel the approach to treating my child's behavior problems in the home by using this type of program is
Notes: 1= very inappropriate; 2= inappropriate; 3=, slightly inappropriate; 4= neutral; 5= slightly appropriate; 6= appropriate; 7= very appropriate

ElementDescription: How confident are you in managing current behavior problems in the home on your own?
Notes: 1= very unconfident; 2= unconfident; 3= somewhat unconfident; 4= neutral; 5= somewhat confident; 6= confident; 7= very confident

ElementDescription: How confident are you in your ability to manage future behavior problems in the home using what you have learned from this program?
Notes: 1= very unconfident; 2= unconfident; 3= somewhat unconfident; 4= neutral; 5= somewhat confident; 6= confident; 7= very confident
